title: Pithole, Pennsylvania
summary: Pithole, or Pithole City, is a ghost town in Cornplanter Township, Venango County in Pennsylvania, about 6 miles (9.7Â km) from Oil Creek State Park and the Drake Well Museum, the site of the first commercial oil well in the United States.[3] Pithole's sudden growth and equally rapid decline, as well as its status as a "proving ground" of sorts for the burgeoning petroleum industry, made it one of the most famous of oil boomtowns.[4][5]
